We got home at 3:50 I went to take the trash out, and the stuff I ordered was sitting in the window sill . It was misting rain and the card and everything got wet. I will not be using them again.

name: trm0608
text:
Growing up in Decatur, Simpson’s is one of few well known florists in town. I, along with my parents and even my grandparents, have used them for a number of occasions over the years. We often used them in Student Council at DHS as well. However, I won’t be using them again going fruther.

I currently live in a different city, but I recently called Simpson’s to inquire about having flowers sent to my mother for Mother’s Day and had an encounter with a employee by the name of Anne that left me dissatisfied. While she might have appeared quite polite by her tone, she came across fairly condescending when I asked if they might be delivereing on the day of the holiday this year. I consider it extremely poor customer service to make any customer feel as if their questions are unwarranted, especially if they’re legitimate. Many florists do deliver on Mother’s Day even if they are normally closed on Sunday because it’s a popular holiday for flowers. She even infomred me they themselves did previously deliver the day of Mother’s Day, but no longer do. So it couldn’t have been that absurd of a question.

Previously, I had no particular preference for either Simpson’s or their other main competitor in town, but going forward I will be doing all of my business with their competitor. It’s not only important to sound polite when interacting with customers, but also it’s just as important to connect and be personable when engaging with customers. Evidently, now there seeems to be a disconnect with some of the employees at Simpson’s and their customers.

resp.text: Ma'am, no one yelled at your daughter. We only requested that you and your daughter leave the bird's nest undisturbed (I even said "please"), because often a mother bird will not return to a nest which has been disturbed. We respect that we share our outdoor space with the local wildlife, and we just don't want the baby birds to die. We want everyone who visits our store to feel welcome, people and wildlife.

name: The Schusters
text: I am so happy with the level of customer service I received from Monica over the last several weeks! I called to see if there were any yellow Lady Bank roses in stock yet, but they had not arrived for the season. Monica took my name and number, and said she would call back to let me know when they arrived. Most places wouldn’t even call back, but she called me back a few days later to let me know when they would be in...then the next week or so to tell me they arrived, AND that she picked the best one for me, and put my name on it. I feel like she went above and beyond what most would do, and it meant the world to me. I specifically needed a yellow Lady Banks to replace one that we lost in a move, which was given to us in memory of our miscarriage 6 years ago. Now, I have the prettiest blooms, and am reminded of our sweet angel in heaven...and also how sweet Monica was to get me what I requested! I will keep going back there, for sure!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We are very fortunate to have her as our Garden Center General Manager! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Rozlynn Bakes
text: I recently moved to the area and was looking for nursery that sold high quality pottery and plants. I thought the Greenery was lovely and had a great selection.  In my short time here in Owens Cross Roads, I have bought 2 wreaths there and several plants.  About 2 weeks ago on a Saturday, I went there and bought 3 house plants and 2 of the Italian made pots, spending $80 in total. I took them home and 2 of the plants have done great but by the following Thursday the third plant had completely shriveled up and died.  It took me another week to get to the greenery to show them my dead plant. When I brought it to the front counter and showed them the plant, they quizzed me on when I watered it and where I put it and then proceeded to tell me it was a very finicky plant 🌱 and I stated my other plants were fine and hadn’t had a plant die in 4 days ever.  I suggested a replacement but they just made me feel like it was my fault it died so tough luck.  They were not rude but also not helpful.  I walked away from the counter shaking my head.  I feel like with so many competitors and options of places to shop that in the end helping me and switching it out would have been no big deal at all.  It was a $14.99 plant.  In the end, I left deciding to not return to that location.  There are plenty other places to buy plants and pottery.

text: We went to The Greenery a couple weekends ago to do the pumpkin drip painting class.  We had such a great time! Monica was awesome leading the class and let us be very creative with our painting.  She was very interactive with us throughout the class and even made a cool video of me doing my pumpkin.  We really enjoyed ourselves and look forward to other classes they may offer in the future.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed the class! We are very fortunate to have Monica as our Garden Center General Manager! Thank so much for your kind words!

name: Pam Davis
text: The Greenery is a beautiful business but I recently had a very disappointing experience with them.   I bought a milkweed from them and it grew very well but never bloomed the whole summer.  I called and talked with them and they gave no solution.  I had hoped they would replace it but they just said "well maybe it will bloom later".  We discussed where I planted it and that was not the issue as it grew tall, just no blooms.  In early fall it died suddenly.  I have always liked the greenery for its quality of plants but I was extremely disappointed in their lack of response to my dilemma and absence of trying to satisfy or help a disappointed customer.

resp.text: We very much regret that our customer service did not meet your expectations and for that reason we would like to provide you with a store credit for the amount that you paid for the plant. Our warranty excludes perennials as they can be a little finicky and are often not as long lived as a tree or shrub. On a positive note - if you haven’t already pulled the milkweed up it may very well put back out in the spring as it is normal for them to go dormant in the fall. If it’s gone and you decide to try another milkweed be sure to plant in full sun where there is good drainage.

name: Isaac Bussey
text:
They started by being understaffed and not being able to get a description of what they have in stock over the phone.
As a landscaper this is a huge detriment, then when I went there to look at stick in person I had to go through 3 people and start over with each one telling them what I wanted and who I was with.
When I finally found a person to help me that is a greenhouse worker we wandered around for a while and they didn’t know where the plant I was looking for was.
Then I find the plant after the greenhouse worker walks past it and doesn’t recognize it.
Then I finally get to the register and they say in order to check out and get a discount for being a landscaper I have to fax in my SLP, which I completely understand, I asked if I could email it after I leave and the employee says yes that’s fine.
I get my SLP and am emailing it and I call them to ask if they can now apply the discount to the order and they say no. They can only apply it to new orders and cannot apply the discount to an old order.

Literally I could take these plants back in there with my receipt and get a refund and then buy them again and I would get the discount.

And no other nursery in the area requires an SLP for the landscapers discount.

Any nursery can sell good plants but it takes a great nursery to have good customer service.

I will literally drive to CatBird Seat in Madison or Indian Creek Nursery on Slaughter road being 25 minutes away before I go here again.

Coming from a landscaper this place was a complete waste of time and the plants at a 20% discount still would have been more expensive then Madison local nurseries.

name: Windy Dobbs
text: I've been to every nursery in NE AL.  Selection, quality, resources and staff are all great.  However, they will not hold up to their 1 year guarantee.  I brought a plant in that had died.  I bought 4 total, 1 didn't make it.  The lady there quickly got on the defensive and stated, we can't take that back in a nasty and rude way.  Then she proceeded to go through a list with me from planting to watering to see if she could find a reason to blame the plant's death on me.  She went with improper watering schedule.  I told her I have an irrigation system.  She asked me how much water it is putting out, I responded, "I don't know the exact output yet, but all the other plants are doing well which is a good indication."  And that was not good enough for her.  So, I just gave up.  It was clearly going to be an issue not worthy of the stress.  BTW:  If you need a tree form ligustrum, Packs Nursery has them for $30 where the Greenery was selling them for $129!!

resp.text: Hi, Windy. I’m very sorry to hear that you had a bad experience when you brought a plant back for replacement under our warranty. We can and will do better than that. Please reach out to us so that we can make it right. You can call me at(256) 518-9836. Thank you, Becky Ray

Great selection. Great care and service. Hearty plants, knowledgeable staff. We keep coming back year after year. Consistently hearty plants.

Compared to the big box stores, Andy's plants have had a higher rate of survivability and hardiness. Demonstrably better plants, probably because the staff is so dedicated to the care and feeding of each plant.

Great knowledge of native plant species. The only place in birmingham I can get reliable insect control species and pollinator-friendly species in the same trip. Such a great selection, my son now has his own nursery in his room and is excited to care for each plant daily. Our front and back yards are now much more our own now that we've put roots down. Thank you, Andy! Your staff rocks!

text: Does Andy's source their compost from a landfill? I ordered 8 yards of compost, which itself was excellent quality, but had to remove 2 full yard bins of trash. Aluminum cans, large pieces of plastic, shredded children's clothing, a loaded shotgun shell and thousands of 1-3" rocks. I expected better of Andy's as we love their nursery and farmer's market but this was disappointing.

resp.text: We hate to hear this. Our compost comes directly from the leaf debris collected and composted by the City of Mountain Brook. We will pass along this laundry list of undesirable items. If you ever have an issue with the products we sell, give us a call so we can amend the situation immediately. 824-0233. Next time you are in, let us know and we will come up with something to amend this.

name: Nicole Matthews
text:
Andy’s is THE best place for home and garden needs. After visiting them I know I need to find a way to incorporate a water feature in my landscape.

For container inspiration and know how consulting Amanda was the best decision. My orchid pots are thriving and look elegant on my dining room table. I’m grateful she took time to explain the design look and thought process behind the design.

resp.text: Thanks for shopping with us Nicole! Great news that your orchids are doing so well. Amanda is a wonderful asset and very knowledgeable.  We are here to help you with all your gardening design needs.

name: Ashley Moran
text: We've used Andy's for years to deliver soil, mulch, plants, shrubbery, Christmas trees, and more to our home. I've also picked up seasonal plants, ferns, flowers, and vegetables that have all been very hearty & healthy. The employees, particularly Rodney & Andrew, have always gone out of their way to be helpful and make sure I got exactly what I needed for the best price. We will continue to use Andy's for many years to come!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words Ashley! We look forward to serving you in the future!

name: justin bradford
text: Andy's is amazing! I loved working with Amanda. She really knows her stuff. Great selection great prices. So convenient to Vestavia. I will be back!

resp.text: Justin - Thanks so much for shopping with us!

name: Amanda Dalvi
text: Super knowledgeable with great friendly staff. They even drew me a diagram of how to plant the trees I bought. And the selection of what you're looking for is phenomenal. Will go back to finish my backyard paradise 😉

resp.text: Amanda, thank you for coming in. Happy that we could help. Can’t wait to see some pics of that backyard paradise.

name: Elizabeth Livesay
text: I can’t say enough good things about Andy’s. We re-did the shrubbery in front of our house and they walked us through The whole nursery and gave us advice on what to get and how much. They also ordered anything they didn’t have in stocked and had it all delivered in less than a week! The prices are VERY resonable as well. So happy with my experience and the amazing customer service.

resp.text: Thank you so much for shopping with us! We are always here to answer any questions you may have. Look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Rider 0401
text: Andy's is the best!  They have an AMAZING selection of plants and planters and they are the only nursery that can make a soil mix that keep my succulents alive!  I have bought some succulents on the off season online and in the commercial stores and they don't hold a candle to Andy's.  The staff is just phenomenal, very knowledgeable and happy to answer any questions.  They also have a really cool little koi pond that my boys love!

resp.text: Kristina, thank you for coming in and shopping with us. The next time your in we have some fish food that the boys can use to feed the fish.

resp.text: Thanks for the five star review Judy! We love helping customers with their questions. Look forward to seeing you again soon!

text: I visited Andy's Creekside nursery  I was able to find different kinds of perennials that I don't have .I wished that there was a nursery close to my house that was as friendly and had the selection of Andy's. They were such a blessing for me .I don't live in Alabama and was there to help my son who had been sick , I will never forget their kindness , concern , and patience they showed to me . I will be going back on my next visit to Alabama .

resp.text: Our Nursery is ever changing throughout the seasons. We look forward to serving you next time you're in town.

text: thank you to the staff @ Amy's..  We live out of town, I called late morning and placed the order for our daughters birthday. name: Bobby Hagler
text: I ordered flowers for my wife on our 40th anniversary at 4:30 pm on 5/28 to be delivered between 12:00 - 2:00 pm on 5/29. They send an email at 11:57 am on 5/29 cancelling the order. This is pathetic.

resp.text: We apologize for the miscommunication in your order, Bobby. Given the long weekend for Memorial Day, we were closed Saturday and Monday. We also had a technical issue that didn't reflect our correct hours online. We understand your frustration and we are sorry for the inconvenience. If you'd like to discuss this further offline, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Felisha, Owner

name: Camy Caruso
text: I just called there to order flowers for my daughter in law.  The lady who answered the phone was rude. She acted like it was an inconvenience.  I'm glad I didn't spend my money on the flowers there. And the 1 star was too much. Ordering somewhere else!

resp.text: Camy, I'm so disappointed to hear we've left you with such a poor impression. You should always expect to be treated like a friend when you work with us to create a beautiful arrangement, and I can assure you this was just a misunderstanding. I hope you'll consider giving us the chance to make things right. -Felisha, Owner

name: Neica Asher
text: I ordered flowers online and called with special delivery instructions. Amy's you went above and beyond with your customer service. Thanks for delivering beautiful flowers and being so friendly to the lady that received them. Excellent experience all around!

resp.text: There's nothing like getting to share smiles with our neighbors, Neica. It was our pleasure to deliver the beautiful arrangement for you. Please don't hesitate to give us a call if you ever need anything. -Felisha, Owner

name: shirley smith
text: I used Google to find a place to deliver something, out of the ordinary, for a friend staying at a local hotel---and since it didn't require flowers I was at their mercy. The kind receptionist was able to help with everything in a matter of a few minutes... EXCEPTIONAL. Thank you!!

resp.text: Thanks for the support, Shirley! Glad to hear we were able to help out with your delivery. Let us know if you ever need anything else. -Felisha, Owner

text: Great experience, Arrangement looked great! I will definitely use Amy's again.

resp.text: Teddy, I'm happy to hear that your order was everything you wanted. Our arrangements are some of the freshest in the area, so we're happy that you'll continue to support us. If you'd like anything specific, feel free to let us know next time. -Felisha, Owner

name: Jeri Moody
text: I called Amy's Florist from Georgia in hopes of ordering a plant for my son's girlfriend who just had surgery. Mark was a pleasure on the phone. He was very helpful in suggesting a plant, as well as tips on how to care for it. The delivery guy was also kind and delivered it promptly as well. I would definitely use Amy's again if I find myself needing another delivery in Tuscaloosa, AL. Thank you!!

resp.text:
Jeri, thanks for the stars! We're so glad to hear we were able to help you out. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything else!
-Felisha, Owner

name: Larry Savino
text: I am in New York and needed a Great Easter basket for my Daughter who is in Tuscaloosa for college. I called in morning and the women I spoke with was very polite,Patent,and knowledgeable of her products. I described what I wanted she said NO PROBLEM, ask me for my budget and 3 hours latter my Daughter called and said she loved it. What more could you ask for from a vendor. Thank you to the staff at Amy's I appreciate the great service we received

resp.text: Larry, I know a year has gone by, but I just had to stop and thank you for these wonderful words! I'm happy we were able to help you make your daughter's day. I appreciate your support and hope you won't hesitate to reach out next time you need anything. -Felisha, Owner

name: CATHY HOWELL
text: I went in to Amy’s to get a plant for a funeral and there was 3 different people helping us and we got 3 different prices.  So unorganized. Feel as tho they are ripping people off!!  Watch when you order!  NONE of the flowers had prices so we had to ask. We left and went to Stephanie’s where all the plants had prices you knew what you were paying for.

resp.text:
Cathy, we try to be upfront with our prices, so I'm sorry to hear you didn't leave with that impression. I appreciate your feedback, though, and I hope you'll give us another chance in the future. Take care.
-Felisha, Owner

name: Virginia Sanford
text: Always very helpful with choosing the right flower or plant. Also very helpful with last minute needs.

name: Mona
text: I was sent some flowers by my boyfriends parents for Christmas. The whole arrangement fell apart when I got it, as they cut the stems so short they wouldn’t even stay in the container. It was mostly filler and the flowers died within 2 days. Highly disappointed.

resp.text: Mona, we're always happy to be a part of such sweet gestures. However, we searched our database history and don't see the transaction you're speaking about. I can assure you that our displays are well-made and always fresh. That's what sets our flowers above the rest. In the future, we're always happy to provide you with a quality arrangement at a moment's notice. -Felisha, Owner

name: Jennifer Stigall
text: Great experience using Amy's Florist! Very nice people to work with!  I definitely recommend using them, and they are LOCALLY Family owned!

resp.text: I know a couple of years have gone by, Jennifer, but I didn't want to miss the chance to thank you for this awesome review! Your recommendation means the world to me, and I'm so happy to read you had a great experience here. Please don't hesitate to reach out next time you need anything. -Felisha, Owner

name: Christian Parris
text: I had a wonderful experience on the phone ordering flowers for my girlfriend. Cynthia was very helpful and funny

resp.text: Thank you Christian!  We hope your girlfriend enjoys her flowers.

name: M P
text: Terrible Customer Service. In attempt to getting my girlfriend some Halloween themed flowers, Amy's Florist dropped the ball. I placed an order for one item and 5 minutes later they called and said they did not have the item or vase in stock YET I was still charged. After emailing and calling back, I was fully refunded. I decided to try my luck again and place another order but for a different item. Same thing, received a call saying it was not in stock. The people calling me were horribly unhelpful and rude and made it seem like I was to blame. Why have something on your website if it not in stock? I also find it suspicious Amy's Florist and Pat's Florist have the same exact webpage layouts besides color scheme. Trying my luck at a third floral shop and see if I finally can get something...

resp.text: Matthew, I am very sorry you had a bad experience with us. Yes you placed an order off our website that stated NO substitutions.  The closer it has gotten to Halloween we have sold out of most the containers. We would have been glad to do a similar arrangement for you but you said no substitutions. Also you did email us and I got back with you as soon as I seen the email, unfortunately I don't check my emails frequently.  The staff called and left you a message regarding the order, and soon as they spoke with you a refund was issued.  As for the two websites bringing the same...YES they are because a floral company designed them for us.  Nothing suspicious at all about that.  Again, I am very sorry we wasn't able to help you. It is not our goal to lose customers.

name: N Hinton
text: My Dad works here. The manager and staff are very cordial and my father ,one of the delivery guys, is extremely attentive and punctual in delivering the flowers. My Dad's a work-a-holic.

resp.text: I know several months have passed, but I didn't want to miss the chance to thank you for this wonderful review! We love having your dad on our team, and we appreciate your reaching out with an all-star rating. -Felisha, Owner

name: Ben Tuckerman
text: Friendly staff. Locally owned. Beautiful flowers. What's not to love!!

resp.text: Thank you, Ben! Please don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything else. Take care. -Felisha, Owner

name: Jack Przebienda
text: Flowers were delivered and my girlfriend absolutely loved them. Great Value, would recommend

resp.text: We are so glad she loved them. Thank you for call Amy's Florist. We look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Andrea White
text:
Really rude people! Terrible customer service.  Called to get more information on their flower arrangements, unfortunately their website is limited on options so I went on their Facebook page and was able to find a lot more options for what I was looking for.  I had to literally described them the flowers I was looking at, and told them it would be easier for them to jump on their page with me .... nop! They started getting all mad and raised their voice over the phone because THEY DIDN'T KNOW how to even use Facebook.  The woman that was on the phone with me even started talking over me.  WILL NEVER buy anything from here and WILL NEVER recommend this place.
One star is even too much!

resp.text: Andrea, we want all of our guests to feel comfortable when talking to us, so I'm sorry to hear about your experience. It sounds like there was a miscommunication here, and I appreciate the feedback. If you do choose to do business with us again, we'll work hard to make it a better experience. -Felisha, Owner

name: Pat Stephenson
text: Nice folks, but somehow they lost the order, it was a funeral so you only get one shot at it.

resp.text: Pat I'm sorry to hear this.  I have researched our data base and I'm not showing where an order was placed in your name.  I surely hope if the order was placed with us, that we took care of you to make sure you where completely satisfied.

name: Holly Holman
text: Extremely disappointed in Amy's.  I just sent my mother a birthday bouquet via Teleflora and paid extra for the Premium bouquet which featured a larger arrangement with more flowers (6 large roses and 6 smaller roses).  My mother just texted a picture of the flowers to say thank you and there are 2 roses and a bunch of filler flowers.  I'm in Kansas City, but believe if I were at home, I would be making my way to have a serious talk with Amy or whoever stole my money.  I could've gotten more money's worth out of a Publix bouquet.  I'm seriously angry.  This was NOT a $95 arrangement.

resp.text:
Hello Holly,
I'm so sorry you were disappointed in the arrangement. It's not our goal to make customers unhappy.  In this situation going through a 3rd party to place an order is not always the best thing to do. You mention you spent $95 on the arrangement but that's not what the sender gave us to work with. Also, out of the total, we had to take out for the 2 balloons and delivery charge that was associated with the order.  Yes, you could have got more flowers from Publix, but I don't sell Publix quality flowers. I only carry the freshest and finest. I agree the arrangement doesn't look like the picture you picked out and I'm more than happy to correct our mistake.  We want every customer to be completely satisfied ...that's our goal. We gain nothing from an unhappy customer!

name: Brian Patterson
text: I certainly wouldn't buy from a place that hangs up on its callers, as a vendor.... very unprofessional

resp.text: Not sure why you would make a statement as such!  My staff and I are very friendly to every caller unless you are a telemarketer.  We all know how annoying that can be.

text: Not so nice.  The person I ordered from had an attitude the entire time I was on the phone.  UA discount or not, I do not recommend.

text: I got my plants through PlantsByMail.com which is part of Flowerwood Nursery. I had been a regular customer over the past few years. When I pointed out to them that they charged me for a 3-gallon plant and all I got was a 2-gallon plant, they refused to re-price the plants for me. I sent photos and said these were the same size as the many 2-gallon plants I had ordered in the past. They claimed it was 3-gallon. I asked them to send me a size standard for a 2-gallon versus 3-gallon plant, i.e. height and width of plant. They wouldn't do it. They simply want to over-charge and give no the benefit to a loyal customer. I won't do business there again

name: Selina Finsel
text: I don't understand the bad reviews, especially towards the management. I am currently employed there for seasonal work and, all of the managers I have worked with so far have been pleasant to me. I haven't had any problems with the employees either. You are expected to stay busy at all times while on the clock. I think that is fair since we are getting paid to work. I enjoy working there because we get moved around doing different things so, it's not boring and, the time goes by fast. I can't complain about the pay either. All around, it's a great place to work.

name: Heather Bobo
text: Place to work great . Leaders on floor are not leader quality . Love to throw the hardest workers under the bus and push out for own personal gain. Disrespectful, rude, and not adult functional . When your the minority your the problem.

name: Accustomed Toitall
text: Very toxic workplace VERY.!. Employees are very RUDE, MESSY, and OVERLY worked.. The Owner and Admin DO NOT CARE of the employees here whatsoever so DONT waste your time/gas with this place. If I could give a zero star I’d give them half of it

text: Five Stars for this place. We needed a hedge. Nancy showed us just what we should buy. The hardest working guy I've ever seen, Augie (with his wife and brother in law) came out on a Saturday and planted. Beautiful, healthy plants. Expert service and a great performance by everyone. The hedge looks great!!

text: So I just called Magnolia Landscape Nursery. The person answering the call greeted me with hello... I wasn't sure that I had actually called the correct number so I asked is this Magnolia nursery he said yes. I said if you have a minute I'd like to ask some information about pricing... He told me he did not have time. Not even sure I know what to say.I guess if you have enough business you don't even have to be polite.

text: Good size nursery with a great selection of landscape plants,soil, fertilizer,pest control and knowledgeable staff.

name: Jim Thompson
text: Helpful, courteous people  . Great selection and prices are equal to those at the big box places.

name: T.D. Taylor
text: They have an impressive selection and equally impressive staff, Nancy Johnson was incredible, she knew the ins and out of each plant. Nancy assisted with plant choices, heights and size and what each required she was very friendly, patient and helpful.. they have a huge variety of plants for home or gardens. This is one of those places you have to visit more then once. A good way to get started with our garden. The plants are also very inexpensive especially since they are not a big box retailer.

name: Linda Nolen
text: Had just what I went for!  Satsuma trees and a Washington Navel Orange tree!

name: Miranda McGregor
text: Love this nursery!  Staff is very friendly and very knowledgable about their stock, when they will have specific types of plants and best times to plant in our area. Purchased 2 crepe myrtles here and will be back. Very reasonable prices as well. Highly recommend stopping in if you're looking for good quality plants.

name: John Westendorf
text: Good selection of trees

name: Dan S
text: Great and extremely knowledgeable people!

name: Sandra Wessler
text: I guess customer service is not one of the services that Magnolia provides. I visited there yesterday and no one person came up to me and asked if they could help me. I wandered around the lot and nobody bothered to ask if I needed help. I was prepared to spend a great deal of money, but now, I will never go there again. I was bitterly disappointed and can't, in good faith, suggest this business to anyone.

name: Judson E Crump
text:
Best Selection of plants in Baldwin County.  This place is huge.  They have just about every landscape plant that people use around here, plus a decent selection of specialty plants and fruit trees.  The plants are all in good shape and the people here are knowledgeable about what grows well and what doesn't.

Unlike Lowe's, Walmart, etc., this is a local place that doesn't supply mass produced junk that won't grow well here.  Definitely recommend this place.

name: Robert Brown
text: This is the place if you are looking for healthy, beautiful plants with great plant expertise. Especially, for plants that you can't find at HD or Lowes. Not the cheapest around, but the plant quality and knowledge is unmatched in Baldwin County.

name: Nancy Poling
text: Was just at Magnolia  Nursery  2 days ago . Great selection and very knowledgeable  staff.

text: I would never buy from them nor refer any person or business to them. I had a landscape designer refer us and it was the worst experience I've ever had. Not only was I sold half dead plants for $300+ but once I realized I purchased the wrong plants on the design and tried to exchange them the following business day, I was told that "once you take it, it's yours." No credit, no exchange, no return. I can understand weeks out but THE FOLLOWING BUSINESS DAY?! Never again. I am a business owner and I would NEVER treat my customers like this! I will be sure to tell everyone I know.

text: They have a nice selection of landscape items period ranging from mulch to plants to decorations. Prices may vary from day today. For an example Cast Iron cooking pot which may cost $60 one day maybe 20 in a couple of weeks.

name: Stephen Moore
text:
Hands down the best and most helpful hardware store on the Eastern Shore. The folks there are actually so helpful I drive there pretty much every weekend from Mobile for something.

It’s refreshing to have a place you can go where folks take time to actually help you. My go 2 guy there is Ridge. I have never had a single project he did not direct me in the right direction and tried to find the most cost effective option.

I give these guys my highest recommendation
5 ⭐️ Plus

resp.text: Thank you for your support, Stephen!  Appreciate the review!

name: Larry Barnette
text:
I'm in there a LOT. Their fastener section is better than the big chain stores.
The only complaint I have is the guy at the register that asked me why I was wearing a mask, and I told him that I was in heart failure (I should have told him to mind his damn business) he then told me me that he had TWO heart transplants and his cardiologist told him NOT to wear a mask, as if to belittle me.
I'm not calling him a liar, but my Cardiologist sure wants to meet his doctor.

name: Jack Minto
text: Stopped by Home Hardware in Daphne Sat but they were closed and walking out of the door to go home.   I started to leave but Amanda stopped me and asked what I was needing.  I told her and she said she would help me.  What a great experience I had there and I thank them for going above and beyond.  We are lucky to have them in Daphne.

resp.text: We're so glad to help you out, Jack!  We're happy to be in Daphne!

name: Derrick Crane
text: The hours on Google state they are open at 7 am on Saturdays.  At 7:06 the lights were off and the parking lot was empty.  They've been open before at 7 am as I've been there.  Come 11 am I called and couldn't get anyone to answer a phone.   A friend of mines business had a delivery scheduled from them today as well, and nobody showed up.  I like dealing with small locally owned businesses, but the big box store got the money today simply for being open during their stated hours.  This place seems to have gone downhill since changing ownership.

resp.text: Hi Derrick, thank you for sharing your experience.  We've shared them with the senior managers to review.  If you would like someone to reach out directly, please feel free to fill out a form on our website: https://www.homehardwarecenter.com/Contact-Us

text: Great place to shop.  Inventory compairs to big box stores.  Sales associate always willing to help.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your review, John!

resp.text: Thanks for your support, Bryan!

text: The only good worker they had was Kerry. Now that she is gone, there isn’t one single motivated worker in the building. It’s a shame.

resp.text: So glad we could help you on your project! Thanks for the review!

She is probably holding the world record of the most unfriendly, rude and useless hardware store associate. Don’t  dare ask her how she is doing  - she will probably grunt at you and roll her eyes. Rumor is that one person saw her once with the smile. Just a rumor...

resp.text: We're very sorry to hear about your recent experience. We're usually known for our customer service, and we apologize that we missed the mark. We appreciate your feedback and hope to better serve you in the future.

Visited this location because I was in a hurry to find some pvc parts and it was on my way home. I wasn’t greeted at the door, and couldn’t find anyone to help me. It looked like it had a nice variety and good prices, but the customer service was lacking.

Visited for a second time after the managers wrote me on Facebook apologizing for my experience. Sadly, the same thing happened when I went in.

name: Daniel Bostick
text: The most awful unfriendly downright wretched place I have ever attempted to do business with..  I even went back and tried 3 times thinking the first two may have just been bad days for the beyond homely slightly female in some characteristics, although too difficult to say for sure whether it was a man, woman, or some evil physical manifestation of a succubus.  I can not understand for the life of me how they are still in business.  Must be a sham front store for something else or they have too my foolish pride to consider closing the doors even if it would be step one by any professional who reviewed their service standards for 15 seconds.   Oh and the prices are Beyond ridiculous!  Do yourself a favor and keep driving for 10 minutes until you hit home depot and lowes.  Only in this case would i recommend those big box stores over something local, but this case is far beyond extreme!

text: I came in the morning with my 3 children hoping to purchase a few plants and get in and out. I lugged around a cart for 30 minutes and even after one employee saw me, he went back inside and did not greet me or help me. When I went inside to checkout, a gathering of employees was behind the register chatting and not paying any attention. I had to greet them and let them know I had merchandise to pay for. And then they justified not helping me out because I had a few  “tiny” terra-cotta pots and two plants (which were actually 12-18” pots). They paid more attention to my kids than to me, the paying customer. This plant lady is sticking with Wilseys from now on.

name: Arlene Dean
text:
We have shopped here several times & have found what we needed nearly every time. Most recently a gentleman helped us in the plumbing department & knew more about the issue we were having than the so called plumber we hired (that came to our home twice & still didn't fix the issue).
The water refill tube the Home Depot employee opened for us to test, and sold to us, fit perfectly & solved our problem.
We also purchased our holiday tree & holiday greenery at this location.  Nick, the helpful young man that trimmed & wrapped the tree for us, did a perfect job. We have lived in a variety of cities and states and this is hands down our favorite Home Depot location.

name: Scamuel Jones
text: This place is a total loser.  I could not find two common plants I was looking for in the lawn & garden.  Then I clicked to "chat" and was told I was #1 in the queue and then no one ever chatted!  I would suggest not even wasting your time at Home Depot for anything.  Try Lowe's or local nurseries, since these people totally IGNORE their customers!

name: Mason
text: Helpful staff but they often don't have what I'm looking for.

name: Amy Clement
text:
I live just down the street from this Home Depot and EVERY time I go into this store, I can never find anyone to help me.  It looks like a ghost town at the front of the store.  Are you under staffing this store, or are the employees hiding in the back?  I will say that I mostly come to this store after 5pm usually.

I thought it was important to let you know this because if things do not improve, I will just go across the street to Lowe's where they have always been more than happy to help me.  Your store is my neighborhood store, and I want to see you succeed and not go under because of poor management decisions with either hiring bad employees or not paying your staff enough to care about the customers.

Thanks!

text: awesome variety of plants and delicious foods. only complaint is that almost all of the food and a lot of the plants have plastic packaging so it's hard to be zero-waste if you want certain things. prices are a little high but always worth it because the plants always thrive. the honey is delicious.

resp.text:
Hi Virginia! Thanks for taking the time to review us and we're glad you notice our work in getting a lot of variety in our plants and working to get high quality and local goods.

We will give your feedback to our vendors and suppliers and see how we can be more green in the Green Valley.

name: Ro bn Barb
text: Very nice but no help

Thank you for your visit. We are struggling mightly to have staff on the yard to help every customer. Call me if i can ever help you personally.
Ken
256-648-1065 cell

name: Julie Helton
text: Best place to buy your plants

name: Steve Moates
text:
BEWARE! There are two separate businesses in Green Valley: the market and flowers and the landscaping.  You can judge the flowers for yourself and should get a good quality product.  I would recommend Porters just across the river for a much larger selection.
Now the BEWARE.  I hired Ken Irby to do my landscaping.  His crew did a good job.  As soon as the job was done and the sod laid I was very satisfied.  THEN IT RAINED.  I took pictures of the washed-out sod to the business and showed it to one of the landscapers.  He immediately said they did not put pins in the sod so it washed away.  I then went into the office and showed MR. IRBY.  He said he could fix it for over $1000.
I stated that since it was his workers' error it should not be that much.  He and I agreed to $800 to fix.  I know.  Why should I have to pay anything? As of today, November 4, 2020, I have not gotten responses from e-mails or calls.  I still have a mess and have waited too late to resod because MR. IRBY did not keep his word.  IF YOU DEAL WITH THIS MAN GET IT IN WRITING AS HE IS NOT TO BE TRUSTED.

In response to Mr. Irby.
You try and make yourself look like you will take care of a problem you created. (And charge me $800 to do so).  I REMIND YOU.  I came by your business and left a message, I called you,  left a message, I texted you and you did not contact me at all.(I can send copies)  You had my phone number, email and text and YOU INVITE ME TO CALL YOU.  I HOPE PEOPLE SEE THROUGH YOUR RESONSE THAT YOU WILL TAKE CARE OF us.  Please do not worry about the problem I will take care of it.

resp.text:
Steve,
Happy to get to your home and get this right.
Ken
256-648-1065 cell

resp.text:
Thank You!
Ken

text: I direct events for Billy Reid in Florence, Alabama and Green Valley is an incredible partner that elevates our event environments in a major way. Their staff also has a great understanding of venues, event flow, and can provide ideal placement of their inventory without direction. When I book Green Valley to be a part of an event I don't have to worry about anything. They totally take care of making a venue look beautiful. We are grateful to work with them year after year.

name: Natalie Gregg
text:
Paid $950 for a job poorly done because I was immediately threatened by the owner Ken Irby that I would be handed over to collections, although before the job was even started he personally told me I didn’t have to pay until I was happy with the job.

First, he made an appointment to install a gravel driveway at our rental house on Monday. He (Green Valley Nursery & Landscape) never showed up that day. I questioned him, & he acted like he was doing me a favor by fitting me into his busy schedule. Told me he’d send a bobcat over to finish the job right then... I asked if the gravel was even at the job site, & he replied, “I have no idea! Guess I better check.” Wow! If that doesn’t tell you how unprofessional they are, I don’t know what does? Said he might be able to get the job done on Tuesday. I finally had him nail down a time for Friday, because I like a guaranteed job when I am paying for it. I felt like I had to babysit them to make sure the job would actually get done. Finally, the driveway was installed by people who are supposedly professionals. They literally just dropped off gravel & spread it out a bit. I’m not a professional landscaper, but all the research we found said that the gravel needed to be plate compacted through the process. He said they don’t do that, & he never promised me that. I only expected him to professionally & properly install a driveway... sorry, that’s what I thought they were. Professionals. Nope. He refused to fix the job, even though I was promised I wouldn’t have to pay until I was happy, & he would make it right. He told me he wanted to wash his hands of me, & wished I’d never bothered him. The gravel in this driveway is so loose that the first rain will wash it all out, it’s uneven, has a poorly graded slope that makes it hard to enter the drive without scraping the bottom of your car, & my husband couldn’t fit his Jeep in the carport anymore because there was so much gravel under it. They refused to fix it at the present cost, & said they would plate compact it for another $500. He said, “I’ll bill you, don’t pay it, & I’ll send you to collections. We’ll let the law handle it.” Unbelievable & awful experience. My husband & I could’ve done this job properly for as little as $700, but we decided to hire “pros” instead, & now, we are out $950, & it’s not even done right... meaning more expenses for us now. Do your research before hiring Ken Irby.

name: TheAmazing E-man
text: It's a rose museum! Look but don't touch!!! This place really does have gorgeous roses, many in bloom, but they don't seem to want to part with the exhibits and sell them to you. The greenhouse containing the hybrid roses says "KEEP OUT Please ask for assistance." so you need to go ask permission and get a chaperone who stays with you while you browse to keep an eye on you (awkward). I prefer scent rather than color so obviously I want to smell them, so some of the blooms in the back I had to pull towards me slightly (and I wasn't being heavy handed either, I was being "observed" so i was extra careful). That's when my chaperone said "Please be careful sir they have very delicate stems, they break just like that!"... I felt like I was a kid in a old couples back yard "Don't be touchin' my roses ya' dang wipper snapper! If I'm shelling out cash for plants I want to pick them up, check branching, smell'em, the works, not pick them out behind glass from a line up! After that I said thank you, left and purchased the same roses (though not in bloom) elsewhere without an escort. On the positive side at least they have free admission...
